results.title: If Every Girl Had a Diary
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Sadie Benning’s video diaries form a unique record of the development of a young artist. Within the confines of her bedroom, she creates a dense experimental work about a teenagers search for sexual and non-conformist expression. ‘If Every Girl Had a Diary’ is an intimate insight into suburban malaise and alienation, as well as being a defiantly accomplished piece of video art.
results.description: Sadie Benning’s video diaries form a unique record of the development of a young artist. results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.
results.title_for_label: Just hold still. Parts one and two

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
results.description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. results.title: The Job Interview
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A depressed job-seeker is frustrated in his attempts to obtain work. His fairy-job mother encourages him to consider his positive attributes and apply them in his interviews. Features Graeme Blundell Julie McGregor.

results.title: Public hangings. Series 1. Ep. 05
results.brief_description: Public hangings is a local television program on the arts produced for broadcast on community television (channel 31) in Melbourne, Australia from 2002. Enjoying a cult following, the program produced by Irish art critic and London gallery director, Andrew Mackenzie, roams the streets of Melbourne in search of opening nights and visual vox pops. The programs style makes the avant-garde accessible and provides an insight into a vibrant underground city culture. In this episode Andrew explores Melbourne’s city lane ways, many of which offer public access to street art. He visits City Lights, venue for a a Public Art Project; interviews the author of “Spray Can Art” Jim Prigoff at the Central Station Mural; attends the opening night at Bus Gallery; meets and talks to Mark Amerika at CCP to discuss Amerika’s “Filmtext” (Web Art) Exhibition at the e-Media Gallery and ends the program with an interview with video artist Laresa Kosloff.

results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
results.description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Jason Ramp, Justin Davies, AFTRS and Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
